article.headline: Troy State 85, Georgia St 69
article.story: TROY, Ala. (AP) -- Jerome Stamper scored a career-high 21 points and four other Trojans reached double figures Friday night to lead Troy State to a 85-69 Atlantic Sun Conference victory over Georgia State. Rob Lewin scored 17 points and Kendrick Johnson added 13 for the Trojans (16-5, 12-2 A-Sun). Herbert Evans scored 12 and Greg Davis, who leads the nation in assists, recorded 11 points and 12 assists. Troy State entered halftime with a 42-30 lead and went on a 13-5 run on a pair of 3-pointers by Stamper, making it 70-56 with 10:37 left. Georgia State (13-8, 8-6) got as close as 6 points in the second half, but never caught up. Nate Williams and Lamont McIntosh score 10 points each to lead the Panthers. Georgia State's Trello Galloway grabbed a game-high 10 rebounds. The Panthers hit 54 percent of their shots, while holding the Trojans to 47 percent shooting. But Troy State outscored them 40-28 in the paint and gathered 20 points off the Panther's 17 turnovers.
